Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Timer \Tim"er\, n. 1. A timekeeper; especially, a watch by which small intervals of time can be measured; a kind of stop watch. It is used for timing the speed of horses, machinery, etc. [1913 Webster]
2. (Internal-combustion Engines) In electric ignition, an adjustable device for automatically timing the spark. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]

timer n 1: a timepiece that measures a time interval and signals its end 2: (sports) an official who keeps track of the time elapsed [syn: {timekeeper}] 3: a regulator that activates or deactivates a mechanism at set times
